SENT.plain: The use of adjuvant chemotherapy has improved survival in early-stage colon cancer
Ongoing adjuvant clinical trials are evaluating the addition of targeted therapies to standard chemotherapy regimen
Preliminary results with bevacizumab were disappointing
Also, cetuximab added to chemotherapy does not seem to be better than chemotherapy alone, even in selected wild-type KRAS populations
A better understanding of mechanisms of action of drugs, tumor biology, and predictive biomarkers are needed to design future adjuvant trials
